io.apptik.comm.jus.util

Class PooledBitmapLruCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.util.LruCache<java.lang.String,android.graphics.Bitmap>
      • io.apptik.comm.jus.util.DefaultBitmapLruCache
        • io.apptik.comm.jus.util.PooledBitmapLruCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageLoader.ImageCache, BitmapPool

    public class PooledBitmapLruCache
extends DefaultBitmapLruCache
    True pooled Bitmap Cache. It works as follows. BitmapLruCache gets full --> overflowed bitmaps goes to the BitmapLruPool BitmapLruPool gets full --> evicted bitmaps gets removed and eventually recycled by GC Note that explicit Bitmap.recycle() is not called since it might be still used somewhere else (recycleview/listview for example) and also GC is doing perfect job anyway.

      • addToPool

        public void addToPool(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        adds bitmap to the LRU pool. If limit is reached value will be thrown at LruCache.entryRemoved(boolean, Object, Object, Object) where it will be handled by DefaultBitmapLruCache.addToPool(Bitmap).
        Specified by:
        addToPool in interface BitmapPool
        Overrides:
        addToPool in class DefaultBitmapLruCache
